c74object.name: sdt.friction~
c74object.digest: Friction interaction between two solid objects [solids].
c74object.description:
sdt.friction~ simulates the nonlinear friction force arising when two solid objects rub on each other.
N.B. It must be used in conjuction with two solid object models (either sdt.inertial~ or sdt.modal~) forming a structure "object 1 ↔ sdt.impact~ ↔ object 2". This is achieved by specifying the two objects' IDs as creation arguments.
Friction force is computed from the relative velocity between the contact points of two solid objects as the sum of four components: an elastic term, an internal dissipation term, a viscosity term, and the gain of a pseudo-random function representing noise related to the surface roughness. More subtle phenomena, such as pre-sliding behavior (gradual increase of the friction force for very small displacements), are parametrized by several other quantities: dynamic and static friction coefficients, break-away coefficient and Stribeck velocity. These phenomena are mostly related to the transients and they are particularly important for a realistic simulation of friction sounds. In more detail:
* Bristle stiffness: affects the evolution of mode lock-in.
* Bristle viscosity (dissipation): affects the sound bandwidth.
* Linear viscosity: affects the speed of timbre evolution and pitch.
* kDynamic friction coefficient: high values reduce the sound bandwidth.
* kStatic friction coefficient: affects the smoothness of sound attack.
* Break-away coefficient: affects the transients of the elasto-plastic state.
* Stribeck velocity: affects the smoothness of the sound attack.
* Noisiness: affects the perceived surface roughness.

outlet.digest: Audio signal: Pickup displacement for the second object.
outlet.description: If there are fewer outlets than pickups, some outputs will not be available. Outlets in excess will constantly output 0.

objarg.name: Unique_ID-Obj1
objarg.digest: Mandatory: Unique ID name set for the sdt.inertial object.

objarg.name: Unique_ID-Obj2
objarg.digest: Mandatory: Unique ID name set for the sdt.modal object.

objarg.name: Max-outlets

method.name: messages
method.digest: Inlet 0: Messages and attributes to the object.

method.name: signal
method.digest:
Inlet 0: External force on probe / object 1, in N.
Inlet 1: If ≠ 0, sets probe / object 1 velocity (in m/s) and puts them in contact.
Inlet 2: Fragment size of the probe / object 1 [0.0, 1.0].
Inlet 3: External force on object 2, in N.
Inlet 4: If ≠ 0, sets object 2 velocity (in m/s) and puts them in contact.
Inlet 5: Fragment size of the object 2 [0.0, 1.0].

attribute.name: force
attribute.digest: Normal force on rubber, in N.

attribute.name: contact0
attribute.digest: Pickup index of the contact point for object 1 (rubber).

attribute.name: contact1
attribute.digest: Pickup index of the contact point for object 2 (resonator).
